name: Kimi
simple_intro_en: Front-end developer, hiker, and a big fan of Jack Russell Terriers, with a keen eye for detail.
Full of energy, intelligence, and fun—just like a Jack Russell Terrier—I am always ready for new challenges.
With years of experience in project planning, data management, and application development, I’ve honed my ability to turn complex data into visually appealing and easy-to-understand interfaces.

My work experience also includes being a exhibition curator. I excel at transforming abstract historical concepts into vivid and layered narratives, creating immersive experiences for the audience—like a tiramisu, where each layer brings a new taste.

Whether I’m designing a website or curating an exhibit, my goal is always to focus on structured thinking, data-driven insights, and information visualization to create seamless and enjoyable user experiences.
I enjoy spending time in nature, which helps me continually sharpen my observational skills and spark new ideas.
